Master Ball.name: Master Ball
Master Ball.description: The very best Poké Ball with the ultimate level of performance. With it, you will catch any wild Pokémon without fail.
Master Ball.effect: Catches any wild Pokémon without fail.

Ultra Ball.name: Ultra Ball
Ultra Ball.description: An ultra-high-performance Poké Ball that provides a higher success rate for catching Pokémon than a Great Ball.
Ultra Ball.effect: Catches wild Pokémon with 2x the rate of a Poké Ball.

Great Ball.name: Great Ball
Great Ball.description: A good, high-performance Poké Ball that provides a higher success rate for catching Pokémon than a standard Poké Ball.
Great Ball.effect: Catches wild Pokémon with 1.5x the rate of a Poké Ball.

Poké Ball.name: Poké Ball
Poké Ball.description: A device for catching wild Pokémon. It’s thrown like a ball at a Pokémon, comfortably encapsulating its target.

Safari Ball.name: Safari Ball
Safari Ball.description: A special Poké Ball used in locales such as the Safari Zone in the Kanto region and the Great Marsh in the Sinnoh region.
Safari Ball.effect: Catches Pokémon in the Safari Zone or Great Marsh.

Fast Ball.name: Fast Ball
Fast Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when catching Pokémon that are usually very quick to run away.
Fast Ball.effect: A Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch Pokémon which are quick to run away.

Level Ball.name: Level Ball
Level Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes more effective the lower the level of the Pokémon compared to your own Pokémon.
Level Ball.effect: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that are a lower level than your own.

Lure Ball.name: Lure Ball
Lure Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when catching Pokémon in or on the water.
Lure Ball.effect: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon hooked by a Rod when fishing.

Heavy Ball.name: Heavy Ball
Heavy Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes more effective the heavier the Pokémon is.
Heavy Ball.effect: A Poké Ball for catching very heavy Pokémon.

Love Ball.name: Love Ball
Love Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when catching Pokémon of the opposite gender to your own Pokémon.
Love Ball.effect: Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that are the opposite gender of your Pokémon.

Friend Ball.name: Friend Ball
Friend Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes a wild Pokémon more friendly toward you immediately after it’s caught.
Friend Ball.effect: A Poké Ball that makes caught Pokémon more friendly.

Moon Ball.name: Moon Ball
Moon Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when catching Pokémon that can be evolved using a Moon Stone.
Moon Ball.effect: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that evolve using the Moon Stone.

Sport Ball.name: Sport Ball
Sport Ball.description: A special Poké Ball that was used during the Bug-Catching Contest in the Johto region.
Sport Ball.effect: A special Poké Ball for the Bug-Catching Contest.

Net Ball.name: Net Ball
Net Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when catching Water- or Bug-type Pokémon.
Net Ball.effect: Catches Water- and Bug-type Pokémon with 3.5x the rate of a standard Poké Ball.

Dive Ball.name: Dive Ball
Dive Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when catching Pokémon in or on the water.
Dive Ball.effect: Catches Pokémon that live in water with 3.5x the rate of a standard Poké Ball.

Nest Ball.name: Nest Ball
Nest Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes more effective the lower the level of the wild Pokémon.
Nest Ball.effect: Catches lower level wild Pokémon with a higher rate (up to 4x for level 1).

Repeat Ball.name: Repeat Ball
Repeat Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when catching a Pokémon of a species that you’ve caught before.
Repeat Ball.effect: Catches Pokémon already registered in the Pokédex with 3.5x the rate of a standard Poké Ball.

Timer Ball.name: Timer Ball
Timer Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes more effective at catching Pokémon the more turns that are taken in battle.
Timer Ball.effect: Catches Pokémon with a higher rate the more turns have occurred (up to 4x).

Luxury Ball.name: Luxury Ball
Luxury Ball.description: A particularly comfortable Poké Ball that makes a wild Pokémon quickly grow friendlier after being caught.
Luxury Ball.effect: Catches wild Pokémon and increases their friendship more quickly.

Premier Ball.name: Premier Ball
Premier Ball.description: A somewhat rare Poké Ball made to commemorate a special occasion of some sort.
Premier Ball.effect: Catches wild Pokémon; received after buying 10 Poké Balls.

Dusk Ball.name: Dusk Ball
Dusk Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when catching Pokémon at night or in dark places, such as caves.
Dusk Ball.effect: Catches Pokémon at night or in caves with 3x the rate of a standard Poké Ball.

Heal Ball.name: Heal Ball
Heal Ball.description: A remedial Poké Ball that restores HP and eliminates status conditions for a Pokémon caught with it.
Heal Ball.effect: Catches wild Pokémon and fully heals them.

Quick Ball.name: Quick Ball
Quick Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective at catching Pokémon when used first thing in a battle.
Quick Ball.effect: Catches wild Pokémon with a higher rate (5x) on the first turn of a battle.

Cherish Ball.name: Cherish Ball
Cherish Ball.description: A quite rare Poké Ball made to commemorate a special occasion of some sort.
Cherish Ball.effect: Rare Poké Ball used for event Pokémon.

Park Ball.name: Park Ball
Park Ball.description: A special Poké Ball used in the Pal Park.
Park Ball.effect: A special Poké Ball for the Pal Park.

Dream Ball.name: Dream Ball
Dream Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when catching Pokémon that are asleep.
Dream Ball.effect: A special Poké Ball that appears out of nowhere in a bag at the Entree Forest. It can catch any Pokémon.

Beast Ball.name: Beast Ball
Beast Ball.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is not very effective when catching Pokémon.
Beast Ball.effect: A special Poké Ball designed to catch Ultra Beasts. It has a low success rate for catching others.

Strange Ball.name: Strange Ball
Strange Ball.description: Unobtainable by the player. Pokémon in Pokémon Legends: Arceus that were transferred from other games via Pokémon HOME, as well as Pokémon from Legends: Arceus in Pokémon Brilliant Diamond and Shining Pearl or Pokémon Scarlet and Violet will be displayed in this ball.
Strange Ball.effect: Catches wild Pokémon with 0.75x the rate of a Poké Ball.

Feather Ball.name: Feather Ball
Feather Ball.category: A ball that flies fast and true—ideal for catching nimble Pokémon or Pokémon that fly high in the air.
Feather Ball.effect: If used on specific flying encounters (not including regular encounters that happen to be flying), it attempts to catch the Pokémon with a catch rate modifier of 1.25×. Otherwise, it has a 1× modifier.

Gigaton Ball.name: Gigaton Ball
Gigaton Ball.category: The ultimate iteration of the Heavy Ball. A ball that is too heavy to fly high or far, but it is highly effective if you manage to hit an unsuspecting Pokémon.
Gigaton Ball.effect: It cannot be thrown very far, but is more effective if the Pokémon it's used on hasn't noticed the player. If so, it attempts to catch the Pokémon with a catch rate modifier of 2.75×. Otherwise, it has a 2.5× modifier. During a battle, the modifier is always 2.75×

Jet Ball.name: Jet Ball
Jet Ball.category: The ultimate iteration of the Feather Ball. A ball that flies fast and true—ideal for catching nimble Pokémon or Pokémon that fly high in the air.
Jet Ball.effect: If used on specific flying encounters (not including regular encounters that happen to be flying), it attempts to catch the Pokémon with a catch rate modifier of 2.75×. Otherwise, it has a 2× modifier.

Leaden Ball.name: Leaden Ball
Leaden Ball.category: An improvement on the original Heavy Ball design. A ball that is too heavy to fly high or far, but it is highly effective if you manage to hit an unsuspecting Pokémon.
Leaden Ball.effect: It cannot be thrown very far, but is more effective if the Pokémon it's used on hasn't noticed the player. If so, it attempts to catch the Pokémon with a catch rate modifier of 2×. Otherwise, it has a 1.75× modifier. During a battle, the modifier is always 2×

Origin Ball.name: Origin Ball
Origin Ball.category: A singular and irreplicable Poké Ball that can be used to catch the frenzied Pokémon raging at the Temple of Sinnoh.
Origin Ball.effect: This item is automatically created during the game's story by Lian, Akari/Rei and Laventon and is used at the end of the fight with Dialga/Palkia to catch it.

Wing Ball.name: Wing Ball
Wing Ball.category: An improvement on the original Feather Ball design. A ball that flies fast and true—ideal for catching nimble Pokémon or Pokémon that fly high in the air.
Wing Ball.effect: If used on specific flying encounters (not including regular encounters that happen to be flying), it attempts to catch the Pokémon with a catch rate modifier of 2×. Otherwise, it has a 1.25× modifier.
